[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 80]
Reasoning: **Analyzing the Poker Hand & Developing a Strategy**

Okay, so I'm in a tricky spot, but it's solvable. This boss, "The Arm," is a pain – it *decreases* the hand level I play, which really messes with my chip generation. I need 10,000 chips, and I have zero at the moment. I've only got four hands to make it happen and three discards to work with. Let's see what I'm working with...

My hand is currently: Q♠, 9♠, K♥, 9♥, 4♥, 3♥, K♣, J♣, 2♦.

I've got the "Juggler" which gives me a 9-card hand (which is already set from the initial deal). "Wily Joker" grants 100 chips for a Three of a Kind (3OAK), which is my primary focus. "Shoot the Moon" will be important later, and will give me a boost with each Queen in my hand (since I have one already). I also have "Half Joker" for a nice multiplier if I manage to hold a hand with 3 or fewer cards. Finally, the "Card Sharp" is going to be my key, multiplying the hand if it is played twice in a round.

Right now, I have pairs of 9s and Kings. Getting a 3OAK is my priority. My basic 3OAK (Level 3) would give me 70 chips and a 7x multiplier, but that's not going to cut it alone.

My strategy needs to be:

1.  *First*, get that 3OAK.
2.  *Second*, play that 3OAK; this decreases its level from 3 to 2, and activates "Card Sharp" in preparation.
3.  *Third*, aim for *another* 3OAK.
4.  *Finally*, play that second 3OAK. This is where it gets interesting – at level 1 with the multipliers stacking: "Card Sharp" (3x), "Wily Joker" (+100 chips), "Half Joker" (+20 mult) and "Shoot the Moon" (Holo +10, Queen in hand +13). That should give me a solid chunk of points.

I have 9s (2, 4) and Kings (3, 7) right now, which is perfect. I need either another 9 or a King. The Queen (1) is also crucial for "Shoot the Moon".

The discard decisions are clear: I'm throwing away the 4♥, 3♥, J♣, and 2♦. So that's positions 5, 6, 8, and 9. I'll be keeping the pairs to give me the best chance.

So, I'm going to `discard` the cards in positions `[5, 6, 8, 9]`. That should set me up perfectly for the next draw.



Command: discard 5 6 8 9

[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 81]
Reasoning: **The Optimization of a Poker Hand**

Okay, so the Ante is 4/8, and this is Round 9 against "The Arm" boss – that's going to lower the level of my played hand, which is annoying. The target is 10,000 chips. Currently at zero, yikes. I have 4 hands remaining and 2 discards to get there.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
